Thanks to everyone who came to our theme panel and editorial board meeting at #APSA2015! Safe travels and happy Labor Day
RT @rasmus_kleis: .@AngeMarieH at #APSA2015 panel on Perestroika movement for demographic and methods diversity in pol sci: "what do we nee…
Days left until our Sep '15 issue arrives, centered on themes of incarceration and policing. The cover! #APSA2015 http://t.co/acAN1KpNnV
Thank you to all who participated and attended our theme panel. Some fascinating presentations and Q&A #APSA2015
Jeffrey Isaac: Perspectives is committed to the accessibility of political science research and writing #polisci #APSA2015
Audience Q: What can we all do about the adjunctification of academic labor force? #APSA2015
Smith: We all confront the question of the political significance of our work, and are responsible for confronting this question #APSA2015
Keohane: Someone who says I can show this using only one method has the burden of proof on them #APSA2015
.@henryfarrell: What do we do with political problems that are not compatible with methods considered advanced at the moment? #APSA2015
Katzenstein: There is an aesthetic question of taste that cannot be attributed to a unified method in #polisci #APSA2015
Norton: Each thing we examine in the political world is not about one right issue or answer #APSA2015
Laitin: The political theory canon remains the source of what distinguishes #polisci from other social sciences #APSA2015
Keohane: New problems may require going back to older methods if the groundwork has not been laid yet #APSA2015
Gunnell: When you talk about making #polisci matter, the question is: Whose political science, if we are so diverse? #APSA2015
Standing room only at our panel Perestroika and Perspectives: The Past and Future of US Political Science #APSA2015 http://t.co/6GD1l8IDGu
Smith: Perspectives has been a venue for these larger synthetic arguments and we should take it as a goal for the future #APSA2015
Smith: We should push ourselves to ask how our smaller findings relate to bigger synthetic issues in politics #polisci #APSA2015
Rogers Smith: Perestroika has allowed us to become more self conscious about what we do and can achieve #APSA2015
Norton: We need a larger, braver, more contentious, revolutionary enterprise more openly engaged with the political #APSA2015
Norton: The search for single method, hegemonic consensus and universal standards in the study of politics is misguided #APSA2015
Norton: The firing of @stevesalaita and the attack on the academy in Wisconsin show the effects of politics on scholarship #APSA2015
Anne Norton: We don't drive politics nearly as much as we are driven by it #APSA2015
.@AngeMarieH: It's clear among younger scholars that the distinction between public intellectual and academic is becoming blurred #APSA2015
.@AngeMarieH: We need to confront the reality of shifting demographics of #polisci and casualization of academic labor #APSA2015
.@AngeMarieH: Perspectives is an internally facing journal that has had an external impact #APSA2015
Katzenstein: Ask students, What questions interest you? What methods are appropriate for examining them? #APSA2015
Mary Katzenstein: The understanding of gender in politics required examining more fundamental questions by a variety of methods #APSA2015
Laitin: The promotion of methodological diversity undermines a common focus on key political issues such as nationalism #APSA2015
David Laitin: Diversity of perspectives permits a widening of vision #APSA2015
Keohane: rigor threatens to become hegemonic in R1 departments, trumping genuine engagement with politics #APSA2015
Keohane: we need both a politically vigorous and a scientifically rigorous #polisci. The hegemony of either alone would be harmful #APSA2015
Bob Keohane: Contrary to what many believe, the idea behind Perspectives precedes Perestroika movement #APSA2015
Gunnell: Why do we believe that #polisci should matter or to speak to politics? Why should #polisci be a force in public life? #APSA2015
Gunnell: #polisci has continually attempted to find a way to be proximate to politics but to remain distant from it #APSA2015
John Gunnell: the problems attributed to Perestroika have plagued the discipline since its beginning #APSA2015
